name: Agence France Presse (AFP)
overview: Agence France-Presse SA, a news agency, provides news in video, text, map, diagram, photograph, graphic, and pre-packaged multimedia formats. The company also provides live news and media content for mobile usage; and online news services. It offers news on wars, conflicts, disasters, diplomacy, crimes, business and finance, politics, science, health, environment, science and technology, fashion, entertainment, offbeat, celebrities, culture, social, people, lifestyle, and sports in various languages; and world news. The company’s clients include broadcasters, mobile operators, production companies, digital display solution providers, national news wires, television and radio stations, newspapers and magazines, web sites and portals, mobile operators, corporate clients, and public institutions. Agence France-Presse SA was formerly known as Agence France-Presse SA Agence Havas and changed its name in August 1944. The company was founded in 1835 and is based in Paris, France with operations in Latin America, North America, Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and the Asia-Pacific. It has a regional office in Paris; and regional centers in Washington, Hong Kong, Nicosia, and Montevideo.
